name: Quantitative Aptitude
description: Mathematical and numerical ability testing including arithmetic, algebra, geometry, and data interpretation skills essential for competitive exams

name: Logical Reasoning
description: Analytical and logical thinking problems including puzzles, pattern recognition, sequences, blood relations, and analytical reasoning

name: Verbal Ability
description: English language proficiency including grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension, sentence correction, and verbal reasoning

name: Data Interpretation
description: Analysis and interpretation of data presented in tables, graphs, charts, and other visual formats

name: Coding & Programming
description: Programming logic, algorithm design, data structures, code output prediction, and debugging problems

name: General Aptitude
description: Mixed problems covering basic mathematics, reasoning, and analytical skills for general competitive examinations

name: Technical Aptitude
description: Computer science fundamentals, networking, databases, operating systems, and core technical concepts

name: Verbal Reasoning
description: Advanced verbal logic including critical reasoning, statement analysis, argument evaluation, and inference

name: Non-Verbal Reasoning
description: Visual and spatial reasoning including pattern completion, figure series, paper folding, and mirror images

name: Analytical Reasoning
description: Complex logical analysis, seating arrangements, scheduling problems, and multi-variable reasoning challenges
